intro: Lantana camara f. caffertyi, commonly known as the Cape jasmine, is a compact, evergreen shrub native to South Africa. It features small, fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. The plant has small, leathery leaves that are often covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is well-suited for coastal gardens due to its tolerance of salt spray and drought conditions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking both beauty and resilience.
